intro: Afrormosia schliebenii, commonly known as African mahogany, is a tropical tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, durable wood that is highly valued in the furniture industry. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a glossy surface. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits containing seeds. The tree is often found in moist, lowland forests and can grow up to 30 meters in height.
